sen.j: 道首名（みちのおびとな、天智天皇2年（663年）- 養老2年4月10日 (旧暦)（718年5月18日））は文武天皇朝から奈良時代初期にかけての官人。
sen.e: MICHI no Obitona (663 [2 in the period of the Emperor Tenchi]-May 18, 718, [April 10, 718 in old calendar]) is a government official from the period of Emperor Monmu through until the early Nara Period.

MICHI no Obitona (663 [2 in the period of the Emperor Tenchi]-May 18, 718 [April 10, 718 in old calendar]) is a government official from the period of Emperor Monmu through until the early Nara period.
sen.cmt: ・「京都＿日英」仕様指示書に従って、「○○時代」の表記を修正しました。
sen.e: MICHI no Obitona (663 - May 18, 718) is a government official from the period of Emperor Monmu through until the early Nara period.

sen.j: 姓は君または公。
sen.e: His family name is Kun or Kimi.
His family name is Kun or Ko.
sen.cmt: ・用語集の用語検索によると、「公」はkoと出ていました。
sen.e: His family name is Kun or Ko.

sen.j: 大宝律令の選定に携わり、地方官としても実績を挙げた。
sen.e: He is engaged in the selection of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), and achieved good results as chihokan (a local official).
He was engaged in the selection of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), and achieved good results as a local official.
sen.cmt: ・時制を一致させました。・地方官は固有名詞ではないので英訳で対応しました。
sen.e: He was engaged in the selection of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), and achieved good results as a local official.

sen.j: 死後も長く良吏として記憶された。
sen.e: Even after his death, he was remembered as a good official for long periods.
Even after his death, he was remembered as a good official for long periods.
Even after his death, he was remembered as a good official for long periods.

tit.cmt: ・タイトルなので冠詞は省きました。

sen.j: 出自は不詳だが、道氏は北陸地方の地方豪族であり、首名はその枝族で阿倍氏との関係から中央に進出したとする説がある。
sen.e: The place of his origin is unknown, but there is a theory that the michi clan is a powerful local clan in the Hokuriku region, and his name, Obina came from the name of the branch family that entered into the central region taking advantage of the relationship with the Abe clan.

The place of his origin is unknown, but there is a theory that the MICHI clan is a powerful local clan in the Hokuriku region, and his name, Obitona came from the name of the branch family that entered into the central region taking advantage of the relationship with the Abe clan.
sen.cmt: ・「道氏」は前述の表記に従って大文字としました。・「首名」のtypoを修正しました。
sen.e: The place of his origin is unknown, but there is a theory that the MICHI clan is a powerful local clan in the Hokuriku region, and his name, Obitona came from the name of the branch family that entered into the central region taking advantage of the relationship with the Abe clan.

sen.j: やや先行するが同族と思われる道伊羅都売が天智天皇の夫人となり志貴皇子を生んでいる。
sen.e: This is a different story, but Michi no iratsume, who seemed to be a member of the same clan, became the wife of Emperor Teni, and gave birth to Prince Shiki.
This is a different story, but Michi no iratsume, who seemed to be a member of the same clan, became the wife of Emperor Tenchi and gave birth to Prince Shiki.
This is a different story, but Michi no iratsume, who seemed to be a member of the same clan, became the wife of Emperor Tenchi and gave birth to Prince Shiki.

sen.j: ただし首名との関係は不明。
sen.e: However, her relationship with Obitona is unknown.
However, her relationship with Obitona is unknown.
However, her relationship with Obitona is unknown.

tit.cmt: ・「律令」の頭文字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 青年の頃から律令を学び、官吏としての職務に明るかったという。
sen.e: It is said that he started to learn the ritsuryo codes in his adolescent period, and was familiar with duties of a government official.
It is said that he started to learn the Ritsuryo codes in his adolescent period, and was familiar with duties of a government official.
sen.cmt: ・「律令」は固有名詞なので頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: It is said that he started to learn the Ritsuryo codes in his adolescent period, and was familiar with duties of a government official.

sen.j: 文武4年（700年）6月17日 (旧暦)、大宝律令撰定の功により禄を賜った。
sen.e: On July 11, 700 (June 17, 700 [old calendar]), he was granted roku due to the achievement in selecting Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).
On July 11, 700 (June 17, 700 [old calendar]), he was granted roku due to the achievement in selecting Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).
On July 11, 700, he was granted roku due to the achievement in selecting Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).

sen.j: この時位階は追大壱（冠位・官位制度の変遷冠位四十八階の33番目）であった。
sen.e: His Ikai (Court rank) at that time was tsuidaiichi (the thirty-third grade of the forty-eight grades of transition cap rank in the cap rank and official rank systems).
sen.cmt: 変遷冠位→定訳不明なため→ transition cap rank と訳出しています。
sen.e: His Ikai (Court rank) at that time was tsuidaiichi (the thirty-third grade of the forty-eight grades of transition cap rank in the cap rank and official rank systems).
His Ikai (Court rank) at that time was tsuidaiichi (the thirty-third grade of the forty-eight grades of transition cap rank in the cap rank and official rank systems).

sen.j: 律令撰定に携わった19名のうち、唯一律令を専修していたとされる。
sen.e: He was regarded as the only member that was specialized in the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) among the members who were engaged in selecting the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).
He was regarded as the only member that was specialized in the Taiho Ritsuryo among the 19 selecting members.
sen.cmt: ・大宝律令の英訳（）内は既述なので削除しました。・「律令撰定に携わった」の表現はより簡潔にするため変更しました。・19名の部分が訳抜けでした。
sen.e: He was regarded as the only member that was specialized in the Taiho Ritsuryo among the 19 selecting members.

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)元年（701年）4月7日 (旧暦)に百官の官人に対して新たな令の講説を、6月1日 (旧暦)には大安寺で僧尼令の講説を行った。
sen.e: May 23, 701, (April 7, 701 [old calendar]), he gave kosetsu (lectures such as those on the Buddhist scriptures) on new codes to all the officials, and on July 14, 701,(June 1[old calendar]), he gave kosetsu on Soni ryo (Regulations for Monks and Nuns) at Daian-ji Temple.

On April 7, 701 (old calendar), he gave kosetsu (lectures such as those on the Buddhist scriptures) on new codes to all the officials, and on June 1(old calendar), he also gave kosetsu on Soni ryo (Regulations for Monks and Nuns) at Daian-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ・新暦は原文に併記されていないので削除しました。
sen.e: On May 23, 701, he gave kosetsu (lectures such as those on the Buddhist scriptures) on new codes to all the officials, and on June 1(old calendar), he also gave kosetsu on Soni ryo (Regulations for Monks and Nuns) at Daian-ji Temple.

sen.j: この時正七位下だった。
sen.e: He was Shoshichiinoge (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) at this time.
He was Shoshichiinoge (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) at that time.
sen.cmt: ・「当時」という意味でthis をthatに変えました。
sen.e: He was Shoshichiinoge (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) at that time.

sen.j: 和銅4年（711年）4月7日 (旧暦)従五位に叙せられる。
sen.e: On May 3, 711 (April 7, 711 in old calendar), he was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
On May 3, 711 (April 7, 711 in old calendar), he was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).
On May 3, 711, he was appointed to Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank).

sen.j: 和銅5年（712年）9月19日 (旧暦)平城京へ遷都後初の遣新羅使に任ぜられ、10月28日 (旧暦)に辞見。
sen.e: On October 27, 712 (September 19 in old calendar), he was appointed to the first Kenshiragi-shi (Japanese envoy to Silla) after transferring the national capital to Heijokyo, and on December 5, 712 (October 28 in old calendar), he resigned.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。辞見→定訳不明なのですがここでは resign と訳出しています。
sen.e: On October 27, 712 (September 19 in old calendar), he was appointed to the first Kenshiragi-shi (Japanese envoy to Silla) after transferring the national capital to Heijokyo, and on December 5, 712 (October 28 in old calendar), he resigned.
On October 27, 712, he was appointed to the first Kenshiragi-shi (Japanese envoy to Silla) after transferring the national capital to Heijokyo, and on December 5, 712, he resigned.

sen.j: 翌和銅6年（713年）8月10日 (旧暦)に帰還している。
sen.e: He returned on September 8, 713 (August 10, 713 in old calendar), in the following year.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He returned on September 8, 713 (August 10, 713 in old calendar), in the following year.
He returned on September 8, 713, in the following year.

sen.j: 同年8月26日 (旧暦)に筑後国に任ぜられ、肥後国を兼任した（兼任の日付は不明）。
sen.e: On September 24, 713 (August 26, 713 in old calendar), he was appointed to the post in Chikugo Province in addition to the post in Higo Province he assumed (the date of the appointment to the post on Chikugo Province unknown).

On September 24, 713 (August 26, 713 in old calendar), he was appointed to the post in Chikugo Province in addition to the post in Higo Province he assumed (the date of the appointment to those posts is unknown).
sen.cmt: ・（）内の「兼任」の英訳はthe appointment to those postsでまとめました。
sen.e: On September 24, 713, he was appointed to the post in Chikugo Province in addition to the post in Higo Province he assumed (the date of the appointment to those posts is unknown).

sen.j: 任地においては、人々に生業を勧め、耕作経営や果樹を植えること、鶏や豚の飼い方まで条例を制定し、時宜を尽くした方法を教えた。
sen.e: In the place to which he was appointed, he advised the local people to have a regular vocation, and instructed them on cultivation planning, planting fruit trees, keeping chickens or porks in a timely manner, establishing ordinances on them.

In the places to which he was appointed, he advised the local people to have a regular vocation, and instructed them on cultivation planning, planting fruit trees, keeping chickens or porks in a timely manner, establishing ordinances on them.
sen.cmt: ・任地は筑後と肥後なので複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: In the places to which he was appointed, he advised the local people to have a regular vocation, and instructed them on cultivation planning, planting fruit trees, keeping chickens or porks in a timely manner, establishing ordinances on them.

sen.j: またしばしば任地を巡行し、教えに従わない者に対しては処罰を加えた。
sen.e: He often visited the place to which he was appointed, and punished the people who didn't comply with his teachings.
He often visited the places to which he was appointed, and punished the people who didn't comply with his teachings.
sen.cmt: ・任地は筑後と肥後なので複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: He often visited the places to which he was appointed, and punished the people who didn't comply with his teachings.

sen.j: 人民ははじめ内心恨んで罵ったりしていたが、収穫が増えることになってみな喜び、一、二年のうちにみな従うようになったという。
sen.e: The local people resented and complained about him at first, but they came to follow his teachings within a few years because they were happy that their crop yields increased.
The local people resented and complained about him at first, but they came to follow his teachings within a few years because they became happy to find that their crop yields gradually increased.
sen.cmt: ・「収穫が次第に増えることになり…」というニュアンスの英文にしました。
sen.e: The local people resented and complained about him at first, but they came to follow his teachings within a few years because they became happy to find that their crop yields gradually increased.

sen.j: また溜池や堤防を築いて灌漑事業を広め、「安定した水稲耕作を可能にした」。
sen.e: He `enabled the stable wet-rice agriculture' spreading irrigation constructions by constructing tanks or banks.
He also promoted the know-how on irrigation technology by constructing farm ponds or banks to `enabled the stable wet-rice agriculture'.
sen.cmt: ・分かりやすくするため単語の順序を変えました。・「溜池」は農業用と解釈し、farm pondとしました。
sen.e: He also promoted the know-how on irrigation technology by constructing farm ponds or banks to 'enabled the stable wet-rice agriculture.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 肥後国の味生池（あじうのいけ）をはじめとして肥後や筑後に数々の溜池を造ったという。
sen.e: It is said that he had a number of tanks including Ajiuno-Ike pond in Higo constructed in Higo Province or Chikugo Province.
It is said that he had a number of farm ponds in Higo Province or Chikugo Province including Ajiuno-Ike pond in Higo.
sen.cmt: ・分かりやすくするため単語の順序を変えました。・「溜池」は農業用と解釈し、farm pondとしました。
sen.e: It is said that he had a number of farm ponds in Higo Province or Chikugo Province including Ajiuno-Ike pond in Higo.

sen.j: この地の人々が今この水利の恩恵を受けて生活が充足しているのは首名のおかげであるとされた。
sen.e: It is believed that Obitona contributed to the life of people who lived in the place today for providing them good water facilities.
It is believed that thanks to Obitona's contribution, the local people can enjoy the good water facilities even today.
sen.cmt: ・分かりやすくするため、表現を変えました。
sen.e: It is believed that thanks to Obitona's contribution, the local people can enjoy the good water facilities even today.

sen.j: 青木和夫は、首名が律令を学ぶとともに中国の農業書をも読んでいたと推定している。
sen.e: Kazuo AOKI assumes that Obitona was reading agricultural books of China as well as learning the ritsuryo.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Kazuo AOKI assumes that Obitona had read agricultural books of China as well as learning the ritsuryo.
sen.cmt: ・「読んでいたことがある」というニュアンスにするため、時制を変えました。
sen.e: Kazuo AOKI assumes that Obitona had read agricultural books of China as well as learning the ritsuryo.

sen.j: そのために先進的な中国の技術を用いた農事指導、溜池築造を行えたのだろうとしている。
sen.e: It backs up the fact that he was able to provide agricultural support by constructing a pond that required the Chinese technology.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Because of this, AOKI thinks, Obitona was able to provide agricultural support and construction of farm ponds that required the Chinese technology.
sen.cmt: ・分かりやすくするため単語の順序と表現を変えました。
sen.e: Because of this, AOKI thinks, Obitona was able to provide agricultural support and construction of farm ponds that required the Chinese technology.

sen.j: 霊亀元年（715年）1月には従五位上に、養老2年（718年）1月には正五位下に叙せられた。
sen.e: In February 715, he was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), and in February 718, he was appointed to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In January 715, he was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), and in January 718, he was appointed to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: ・英訳で1月が2月となっていたので修正しました。
sen.e: In February 715, he was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), and in February 718, he was appointed to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 筑後守在任中の同年4月10日に亡くなった。
sen.e: He passed away on May 18 in the same year during his service as Chikugo no kami (the governor of Chikugo).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He passed away on April 10 in the same year during his service as Chikugo no kami (the governor of Chikugo).
sen.cmt: ・日付が原文と異なっていたので修正しました。
sen.e: He passed away on May 18 in the same year during his service as Chikugo no kami (the governor of Chikugo).

sen.j: 任地の人々は没後彼を祠り、また官吏の任務について語る者は彼を範としたという。
sen.e: The local people who lived in the place to which he was appointed worshipped him after his death, and a person who discusses the duties of officials modeled after him.
The local people worshipped him after his death, and he became a good model for a person who discusses the duties of officials.
sen.cmt: ・分かりやすくするため単語の順序と表現を変えました。
sen.e: The local people worshipped him after his death, and he became a good model for a person who discusses the duties of officials.

sen.j: 続日本紀には彼の詳細な卒伝が載せられており、卒伝の記載が原則として淳仁天皇朝以降の四位以上の官人に限られていた続紀において例外的である。
sen.e: The Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued) contains his detailed obituary, which is exceptional in Shokki in which the description of obituary is generally limited to the officials in the court rank higher than the forth after the era of the Emperor Junnin.

sen.j: 後年、彼の子孫である道広持が承和 (日本)2年（835年）に当道朝臣と改氏改姓された際にも、首名の事跡が永らく遺愛されているとされた。
sen.e: In later years, it is said that Obitona's achievements had been loved when 道広持, his descendant, changed his name into 当道朝臣 in 835.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。道広持, 当道朝臣→定訳不明ですが原文のままとしています。
sen.e: In later years, even when MICHI no Hiromochi (道広持), his descendant, changed his name into Todo Ason in 835, it was still said that Obitona's achievements had been appreciated.
sen.cmt: ・分かりやすくするため単語の順序と表現を変えましたが、念のためNC希望です。・「道広持」はよみ方が調べ切れなかったのですが、道首名を参考にすると「みちのひろもち」でしょうか？不明なので漢字も併記しました。・ネット検索によると「当道朝臣」は「とうどうあそん」と読むようです。http://www1.bbiq.jp/sukunahikona/kuukai.htm
sen.e: In later years, even when MICHI no Hiromochi (道広持), his descendant, changed his name into Todo Ason in 835, it was still said that Obitona's achievements had been appreciated.

sen.j: また貞観 (日本)7年（865年）に良吏であったという理由で従四位を追贈されている。
sen.e: In 865, he was conferred Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) posthumously because he was a good official.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 懐風藻には首名のつくった五言詩が一首収載されている。
sen.e: A poem of Kaifusou (Fond Recollections of Poetry), which Obitona created, was contained in Kaifusou (Fond Recollections of Poetry).
A five-character-line poem created by Obitona was contained in Kaifusou (Fond Recollections of Poetry).
sen.cmt: ・前半のof Kaifusou (Fond Recollections of Poetry)は誤植と思われるため削除しました。・「五言詩」という単語がなかったので補足しました。
